info.title: MotaWord
info.description: Use MotaWord API to post and track your translation projects.

get.description: The root endpoint will provide you a JSON Swagger definition.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of supported formats
get.description: Get a list of supported formats for documents, style guides and extensions.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Download your corporate account's global glossary. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Create or update the global glossary.
post.description: Update your corporate account's global glossary. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of supported languages
get.description: Get a list of supported languages

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get your account information and summary.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of your projects
get.description: Get a list of your projects

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

parameters.name: custom
parameters.description: Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value.

parameters.name: documents[]
parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in documents[] parameter. Or you add your documents later in separate calls.

parameters.name: styleguides[]
parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in styleguides[] parameter. Or you add your style guides later in separate calls.

parameters.name: glossaries[]
parameters.description: Optional. Only one glossary is supported at the moment.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.
JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get single project

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: callback_url
parameters.description: Optional. If you provide a callback URL, we will send POST callbacks when the status of the current project is changed. Possible status changes are, 'translated', 'proofread', 'completed'.

parameters.name: custom
parameters.description: Optional. This is a consistent custom data parameter that will be given to you in the response across every request of this project model. Values should be provided like this, custom[my_key] = my_value.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.
get.description: Trigger a call to your callback URL related to this project.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.
JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.description: Download the latest translation package. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.description: Download only the translation package of this language. You must have given a /package call beforehand and wait until the packaging status is 'completed'.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code. You can download the translation of only a specific language.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: payment_method
parameters.description: Optional. Determines which method to use for payment. Options are 'corporate', 'client'.

parameters.name: payment_code
parameters.description: Optional. According to your corporate account configuration, this may be required.

parameters.name: budget_code
parameters.description: Optional with corporate accounts. Not available for others.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Package the translation of all languages to be downloaded.
post.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.

parameters.name: async
parameters.description: If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Track the status of translation packaging.
get.description: This request will tell you the current progress of the translation packaging. You will use the 'key' provided by the /package call.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: This is the package tracking key provided in the response of a /package call.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Package the translation of a specific target language to be downloaded.
post.description: Package the translation project, make it ready to be downloaded.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Language code. You can download the translation of only a specific language.

parameters.name: async
parameters.description: If you want to package and download the translation synchronously, mark this parameter as '0'. It will package the translation and then return the packaged file in the response, identical to /download call after an asynchronous /package call.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get the progress of an already launched project.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.
JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of realtime activities.
get.description: Get a list of realtime activities on the project, such as translation suggestion and translation approval.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get a single realtime activity.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Submit a comment to an activity.
post.description: Submit a comment to an activity.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of comments belonging to this activity.
get.description: Get a list of comments belonging to this activity.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.summary: Get a list of activity comments throughout the whole project.
get.description: Get a list of activity comments throughout the whole project.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get a list of documents

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: documents[]
parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in documents[] parameter. Or you add your documents later in separate calls.

parameters.name: schemes[]
parameters.description: JSON string. If your documents have a scheme, as in cases of CSV files, use the same array index keys for `schemes` parameter to specify their schemes. See `Document Schemes` title in the API documentation.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.
JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get single document

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

put.description: Update the document. File name and contents will replaced with the new one.

parameters.name: documents
parameters.description: Single file data. The name is plural to provide a consistent naming convention.

parameters.name: schemes
parameters.description: JSON string. If your documents have a scheme, as in cases of CSV files, use the same array index keys for `schemes` parameter to specify their schemes. See `Document Schemes` title in the API documentation.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Download a document

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get a list of glossaries

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: glossaries
parameters.description: You can only add one glossary, even though the name suggests multiple glossaries. This may be updated in the future to support multiple glossaries.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.
JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get single glossary

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

put.description: Update the glossary. File name and contents will replaced with the new one.

parameters.name: glossaries
parameters.description: You can only add one glossary, even though the name suggests multiple glossaries. This may be updated in the future to support multiple glossaries.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Download a glossary

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

parameters.name: styleguides[]
parameters.description: Optional. You can add as many files as you want in styleguides[] parameter. Or you add your style guides later in separate calls.

JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Get single style guide

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

put.description: Update the style guide. File name and contents will replaced with the new one.

parameters.name: styleguides
parameters.description: Single file data. The name is plural to provide a consistent naming convention.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Download a style guide

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

get.description: Download your corporate account's global style guide. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Create or update the global style guide.
post.description: Update your corporate account's global style guide. This endpoint is available only for corporate account customers.

parameters.name: styleguide
parameters.description: Style guide file. Currently supported formats: .pdf, .docx, .txt

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

post.summary: Retrieve an access token to interact with the API.
post.description: MotaWord API is using OAuth2 procedures when authenticating or authorizing your API call. Currently, we only allow Client Credential type flow.

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: OAuth2 grant type. Currently only 'client_credentials' available.

200.description: JSON representation of our Swagger API definition.

target_text.description: Target text of the activity, which is actually the translation of the source text.

translator.description: Unique identifier of the translator/proofreader of this activity.

type.description: Currently there are two available activity types; 'translated', 'proofread'.

callback_url.description: Callback URL to notify when project status changed.

custom.description: Custom data provided while creating a new project.

errors.description: A list of errors. Visible when creating a project and uploading your documents at the same time, in case of multiple errors.

status.description: The status of translation packaging. Possible values are 'started', 'packaging', 'completed'. When completed, you can make a /download call to download the last translation package.

type.description: Currently there are two available activity types; 'translated', 'proofread'.

url.description: The URL that received the callback.

key.description: This is the unique package tracking key. You can use this key to track the current progress of the translation packaging with /package/check call.

status.description: The status of translation packaging. Possible values are 'started', 'packaging', 'completed'. When completed, you can make a /download call to download the last translation package.
The status of translation packaging. Possible values are 'started', 'packaging', 'completed'. When completed, you can make a /download call to download the last translation package.
